creator: gmeisenberg
title: Magical Light Up Turtle
description: This project involves creating a light-up turtle with a programmable Circus Play Experience (CPX) disc embedded in its shell. The CPX disc is programmed to respond to various actions like button presses, tilting, and shaking, providing interactive light patterns.
steps: Design your CPX program by assigning responses to button presses, tilting, and shaking using makecode.adafruit.com. Test the commands on the virtual CPX disc and save the file.

Program your CPX disc by connecting it to the computer with a USB cord, resetting it, and then transferring the downloaded program file to the CPX disc icon on your desktop. Test the programming by pressing buttons and tilting the disc.
Construct the turtle shell by stitching felt pieces together in a circular shape. Create a design, considering the placement of the CPX disc's buttons.

Attach the CPX disc and shell by sewing the shell to a felt backing. Ensure the buttons align with the design. Create a turtle body shape from felt and attach the shell to the body, leaving some space open for sewing later.
Attach the battery pack by creating a felt pocket on another piece of felt that matches the turtle body's shape. Incorporate a stretchy band to secure the battery within the pocket.
Sew together the two components (CPX disc, shell, and body with the battery and turtle "belly"), leaving a slight border.
Turn on the turtle by inserting the battery and flipping the switch. Test the various commands by pressing the shell and shaking or tilting the turtle.
